summary: Internal email chain from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York regarding the status and psychological observation of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The emails detail his complaints of physical ailments (numbness, sleep apnea), his request to stay in a 'safe' area, and the plan to return him to the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The incarcerated individual at MCC New York, complaining of sleep apnea, numbness in his arm and neck, and requesting to stay in a 'safe' area rather than return to the SHU.

persons.name: Lopez
persons.context: Another inmate (#20472-038) at MCC New York who is being taken off of psychological observation, mentioned in a staffing update.

events.title: Epstein's Psychological Evaluation
events.description: Epstein is assessed as psychologically stable but complains of numbness in his right arm and neck, and a running toilet in his cell.

events.title: Plan to Return Epstein to SHU
events.description: Epstein requests to stay in the hospital area for safety and to use his new CPAP machine, but staff inform him he will be returned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) the next day.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was on psychological observation at MCC New York in late July 2019.
Epstein complained of physical symptoms including numbness in his right arm and neck, which he attributed to sleep apnea.
Epstein was scheduled to receive a CPAP machine and requested to stay in the hospital area where he felt 'safe' rather than return to the SHU.
Prison staff denied his request for an extended stay, planning to return him to the SHU with a cellmate the following day.
Another inmate, Lopez, was being taken off psychological observation at the same time.
